IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Caring for the sick and feeding the hungry
IRS990.MissionDescription: Caring for the sick and feeding the hungry
IRS990.Description: Hospice Care provides care for terminally ill individuals and their families.

Activity2.Description: Home Health Care provides skilled nursing, physical, speech, occupational therapy, and social work in the home.

Activity3.Description: Home Delivered Meals provide nutritional meals delivered to frail or home bound individuals.

ActivityOther.Description: In Home Assistance Programs provide personal care services for individuals in a non-institutional environment.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Net Assets released from capital restrictions
Amounts of special event expenses included in expenses in the audited financial statements, but a reduction of revenue in Form 990
Included in expenses in audited financial statements, but a reduction of revenue in form 990

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: For Calendar Year 2010 an IRC Section 457(b) deferred Compensation plan was in effect for VNA's CEO and Vice Presidents. $16,500 was paid on behalf of the CEO and each of VNA's four Vice Presidents to an investment account managed by Mutual of America Insurance Company.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Former Key Employee is Principal of Organization

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Patrick Haggerty and Teresa Haggerty Parravano (both Board Members) are siblings.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: VNA's governing board is elected by its Board of Directors, with new Directors chosen and replacing outgoing directors at the end of respective terms.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990 is reviewed by the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors in a committee meeting before it is filed. Management is on hand to answer any questions and give feed back if requested.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Annually all officers and directors of VNA are required to complete a questionaire disclosing all possible conflicts of interest the individual may have with VNA.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: An Executive Compensation review was performed by Longnecker and Associates of Houston, Texas under the direction of VNA's Compensation Committee. Longnecker analyzed CEO and all Vice Presidents of VNA compensation and presented its findings to VNA's Compensation Committee. From those findings the Compensation Committee determined the changes to current officer's salaries and benefits.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Any information can be furnished to the public through a request on VNA's website, or through a phone, email, or mail request.

ReasonableCauseExplanation.Explanation: An extension of time was recieved and approved by the IRS
